TITLE.P: Refresh of National Framework for CAMHS Low Secure and Acute

SHORT_DESCR.P: In April 2015 Velindre NHS Trust — the contracting authority (acting on behalf of the NHS Wales Health Boards listed in Section VI.3) of this notice) awarded a framework agreement for the services listed in 11.2.4 below (the ‘Framework’). The tender process which established the Framework provided for refreshes during the period of the Framework. Accordingly, the contracting authority now seeks to undertake the refresh.
Note: further information is set out in a Pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) and project information memorandum
(PIM) (see Section VI.3) of this notice for details).

TITLE.P: Lot B: Low Secure Tier4 CAMHS Female

SHORT_DESCR.P: Scope of the refresh:
(a) invite potential new service providers to tender for appointment onto the Framework;
(b) allow current Framework service providers (subject always to an appraisal as to their financial/economic standing and sustainability) to vary their service offering in terms of:
(i) revising their pricing (upwards or downwards); and
(ii) apply to add new sites/units onto the Framework.
The scope of the services under the Framework are:
Lot A: Low Secure Tier 4 CAMHS – Male;
Lot B: Low Secure Tier 4 CAMHS – Female;
Lot C: Acute Tier 4 CAMHS – Male;
Lot D: Acute Tier 4 CAMHS — Female.
The framework will expire on 31.3.2021
Service providers already appointed to the Framework are not required to respond to this notice.

INFO_ADD.P: The contracting authority is undertaking the procurement of the Framework on behalf of:
(i) Swansea Bay University Local Health Board;
(iv) Cardiff and Vale University Health Board;

RULES_CRITERIA.P: The procurement commenced in November 2014, so the services this notice relates to fall within Part B of Schedule 3, Part 10 of the Public Services Contracts Regulations 2006. The contracting authority (CA) may voluntarily adopt certain provisions in the Regulations for the purposes of applying selection criteria at PQQ stage, neither the publication of this voluntary notice, the employment of any particular terminology or any other indication shall be taken to mean that the CA intend to hold themselves bound by any of the Regulations save those applicable to part B services. Accordingly, although the contracting authority is seeking to establish an arrangement under which services will be called-off on an ‘as required basis’ such arrangement will not amount to a framework pursuant to regulation 19 of the Regulations. Bidders will be required to enter into terms and conditions as set out in the ITT and that save for clarification or consistency the CA will not negotiate the terms.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: As set out in ITT documents.

INFO_ADD.P: To access the tender go to Bravo eTenderWales at https://etenderwales.bravosolution.co.uk/. Once registered login to the portal and click the ‘PQQs/ITTs open to all suppliers‘ link. Find itt_number and title to access the content and click on the ‘express interest’ button. This will move the ITT into your ‘my ITTs’ page. You can now access any attachments by clicking ‘buyer attachments’ in the ‘ITT details’. To respond to the tender click ‘my response’ under ‘ITT details’. Then choose to ‘create response’ or ‘decline to respond’. You can use the ‘messages’ function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification. Then submit your tender using the ‘submit response’ button.

Note: the authority is using eTenderwales to carry out this procurement process. To obtain further information record your interest on Sell2Wales at https://www.sell2wales.gov.wales/search/search_switch.aspx?ID=95681

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.ADDRESS: 4-5 Charnwood Court, Heol Billingsley, Parc Nantgarw
